title: Lists
content:
## List Operations

- Unlike strings, Lists can have mixed data
- Unlike strings, methods will change the array, no neeed to reassign.
- Unlike strings, lists cannot be reassigned.

### Slicing

- Slicing does not alter the list, you have to assign it to variable

````python
# --------------------------------- LIST SLICING ---------------------------------
# Get All Items starting from third item
print(friends[2:])
# Get Last Item
print(friends[-1])

# Reverse List
reverse_friends = friends[::-1]
print(reverse_friends)
````

### Information 


````python
# --------------------------------- LIST INFORMATION ---------------------------------
# Get String Length
print(len(friends))
# Find item Position
print(friends.index("Eric"))
# Count occurrences of item
print(friends.count("Eric"))
````



### Arithmetic Operations
- Max, Min and Sum

````python
# ------------------------------ ARITHMETIC OPERATIONS ------------------------------

# Sum the Array
cars_sum = sum(cars)
print(cars_sum)

# Get the max value
cars_max = max(cars)
friends_max = max(friends)
print(cars_max)
print(friends_max)

# Get the min value
cars_min = min(cars)
friends_min = min(friends)
print(cars_min)
print(friends_min)
````

### Basic Operations 

- Add, Remove, Extend

```python
# ----------------------------- ARRAY OPERATIONS ---------------------------------
# Append Item at the end
friends.append("Indio")
print(friends)
# Insert Item at Index N
friends.insert(3, "Galana")
print(friends)
# Insert and Override index
friends[3] = "Lupe"
print(friends)



# Remove Specified Item
friends.remove("Michael")
print(friends)
# Remove Last Item
friends.pop()
print(friends)
# Remove Item at Index N
friends.pop(2)
print(friends)

```
### Combining

```python
# --------------------------------- ARRAY COMBINING ----------------------------
# Extend List with another List
friends.extend(enemies)
print(friends)

# Combine two different Lists
everyone = friends + enemies
print(everyone)
```



### Duplication


```python
# ---------------------------- ARRAY DUPLICATION ---------------------------------
# Copy List into new list (Method 1)
new_friends = friends[:]
print("new friends", new_friends)

# Copy List into new list (Method 2)
old_friends = friends.copy()
print("old friends", new_friends)

# Copy List into new list (Method 3)
cool_friends = list(friends)
print("cool friends", new_friends)
```

### Deletion

```python
# --------------------------------- ARRAY DELETION ---------------------------------


# Remove all the elements
friends.clear()
print(friends)

# Delete Array Completely
del friends

```
